LevelHandling

Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • LevelHandling.Maze
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VisibleObject

    public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements VisibleObject
    Maze represents the maze used by MazeRunner.

    The Maze is defined as an array of integers, where 0 equals nothing and 1 equals a wall. Note that the array is square and that MAZE_SIZE contains the exact length of one side. This is to perform various checks to ensure that there will be no ArrayOutOfBounds exceptions and to perform the calculations needed by not only the display(GL) function, but also by functions in the MazeRunner class itself.
    Therefore it is of the utmost importance that MAZE_SIZE is correct.

    SQUARE_SIZE is used by both MazeRunner and Maze itself for calculations of the display(GL) method and other functions. The larger this value, the larger the world of MazeRunner will be.

    This class implements VisibleObject to force the developer to implement the display(GL) method, so the Maze can be displayed.

    Author:
    Bruno Scheele, revised by Mattijs Driel

    • Method Detail

      • removeRedundantFaces

        public void removeRedundantFaces()
        the method removeRedundantFaces removes all the non-visible faces from the levels. this is needed to increase the performance of the game: otherwise a lot of redundant face are drawn and added to the physics world.

        public boolean isFinish(double x,
               double y,
               double z)

        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the player location
        y - y coordinate of the player location
        z - z coordinate of the player location
        Returns:
        boolean that states whether the given position is the finish position.

        public double[] getStart()

        Returns:
        double array containing 1: the x, 2: the y coordinate and 3: the z coordinate of the start position and 4: the initial angle.

      • write

        public boolean write(java.io.PrintWriter wr)
        Writes the maze to a file. First the size is written, then the start and finish positions and finally the maze data.
        Parameters:
        file - File to be written.

      • read

        public static Maze read(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Reads maze from file. The syntax should be as the save method writes it: first the size, followd by start position (three elements) and finish position (two elements) and finilly the maze data, written in a matrix with the size of the maze.
        Parameters:
        file - File from which is to be read.
        Returns:
        Maze that was read-in.

      • setCustomTextures

        public void setCustomTextures(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Set the custom textures and assign all custom maze objects their corresponding texture number. This is necessary to do this because the CustomMazeObjects has a static array of textures, but each Instance of a Custom Maze Objects needs its own number to know what texture it uses.
        Parameters:
        gl - Instance of OpenGL used.

      • display

        public void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Draws the maze. First the textures of all custom maze objects are initialized, if the were not already. Then each object gets a color depending on whether or not it was selected.
        Specified by:
        display in interface VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        gl - the GL context in which will be drawn

      • get

        public MazeObject get(int x,
             int y,
             int z)
        Gets the Maze Object on a certain index on a certain stack, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the stack
        y - index of the object in the stack.
        z - z coordinate of the stack
        Returns:
        The requested mazeObject, if it exists, else a Floor object without dimensions.

        Parameters:

        z - z coordinate of the stack

      • getFloorHeight

        public float getFloorHeight(int x,
                   int z)
        Get the height of the lowest MazeObject in the stack on the given position, or -1 if the position is outside of the maze.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the stack to check
        z - Z coordinate of the stack to check
        Returns:
        height of the lowest floor tile in the stack.

      • getMazeStacks

        public MazeStack[][] getMazeStacks()

      • getNeighbourTiles

        public MazeObject[] getNeighbourTiles(int x,
                             int z,
                             float height)
        Returns an array containing all neighboring tile of the MazeObject of the selected height in the stack on the given position. The MazeObjects in the returned array all have a top that lies above the given height, and a bottom on or below it. If the neighboring stack does not exist, or the stack is lower that the given height, null is returned in the corresponding place in the array.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the stack of which the neighbors are checked
        z - Z coordinate of the stack of which the neighbors are checked
        height - height of the Objects to be returned in the array
        Returns:
        array of objected at the selected height.
